text: Canada has been to every Winter Olympic Games and almost every Summer Olympic Games. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Canada is CAN. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== A Canadian team was not at the 1896 Summer Olympics and the boycotted 1980 Summer Olympics. Canada has won at least one medal at every Olympics. The Canadian Olympic Committee (COC) is the National Olympic Committee for Canada. Canada set a gold medals record in a single Winter Olympics during the 2010 Winter Olympics, which they hosted in Vancouver. ==Hosting the Games== Canada has hosted the Games three times. Millar was selected for ten straight Olympic teams, but was not at the 1980 Summer Olympics.
